title: Jennifer Aniston stalked people on secret Instagram before making account public

Jennifer Aniston has confessed she stalked people on a secret Instagram account before officially signing up.

The Friends actress caused a social media storm this week when she debuted on the site with a picture alongside her former co-stars Courteney Cox, Matthew Perry, Matt LeBlanc, Lisa Kudrow and David Schwimmer.

Jen was immediately welcomed to the site by a host of A list celebrities from Dolly Parton to Salma Hayek.

But the glossy-haired star has since revealed she's been using the site a lot longer than she's been given credit for - after setting up a 'stalker' account first.

(Image: Jimmy Kimmel Live)

Appearing on the Jimmy Kimmel Live! show, Jen said: "It was a stalker account, yes.

"When I was thinking about doing this I figured it was time to kind of understand the world [of Instagram] and dip my toe into the social media pool.”

She then told the host: "I was the most reluctant person to ever join Instagram."

"You just don't do that kind of stuff," agreed Jimmy.

Jennifer has now broken the record set by Prince Harry and Meghan Markle and gaining 1 million followers faster than anyone in Instagram history.

(Image: Jimmy Kimmel Live)

Her first picture - showing her reunited with her Friends cast - has clocked up more than 13 million likes alone.

Jennifer, who turned 50 this year, has since posted two more uploads which have been similarly well received.

One is a video of Jen smashing her phone on the table as she jokes about crashing the website.

"I swear I didn’t mean to break it... Thank you guys for the kind, glitchy welcome," she wrote in the caption.

Her latest post is an adorable throwback of her Jen in her childhood .

The black and white snap shows Jen looking straight down the camera lens. For comparison, the actress recreated the shot clad a similar floppy hat.

"In style then and now," she said.

"Cutie pie," replied pal Reese Witherspoon.

Comedian Whitney Cummings then asked her: "How do you look gorgeous in a floppy denim hat? Makes no sense."
description: The Friends actress is not as new to the world of social media as she'd have us believe
